docs.abstract: From “Lady Bird” to “Three Tall Women” to a revival of “Roseanne,” the 62-year-old actress is finally showing off the extent of her range.
docs.snippet: From “Lady Bird” to “Three Tall Women” to a revival of “Roseanne,” the 62-year-old actress is finally showing off the extent of her range.
docs.lead_paragraph: A unicorn, a monster, a phoenix, a machine, a heavyweight fighter, an astronaut, a superhero, a thoroughbred, a home-run hitter, a waitress juggling “16 entrees, 42 starters, 16 desserts,” a jazz virtuoso, LeBron James, Magellan, Snuffleupagus. The actress Laurie Metcalf has been compared to all of these things. To speak with her colleagues is to blush on her behalf. It is to hear words like “purity” and “devotion” and “work ethic,” delivered with the sober intonations of people doing all they can to rescue them from cliché.

headline.main: Laurie Metcalf Was Hiding in Plain Sight
headline.print_headline: Laurie Metcalf Was Hiding in  Plain Sight

docs.abstract: A pleasant protest against the tyranny of workplace productivity.
docs.snippet: A pleasant protest against the tyranny of workplace productivity.
docs.lead_paragraph: I may be wrong, but my hunch is that, when you go out for lunch with colleagues or even just office friends, you don’t order a martini, let alone three. I’ll wager you don’t order a beer, a glass of wine or a brandy-soaked cherries jubilee. That’s because, a few decades after the heyday of the notorious “three-martini lunch,” the act of ordering even one measly martini with your lunch on a workday is viewed as roughly equivalent to pulling out your heroin works and splaying them on the table between courses.

headline.main: Letter of Recommendation: Drinking at Lunch

docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on an employee’s obligation to reveal the reasons for her absences, and more.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on an employee’s obligation to reveal the reasons for her absences, and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: I am in treatment (weekly therapy and a drug regimen) for clinical depression and a panic disorder. They are, for the most part, very well managed. However, even the most well managed mental illness has flare-ups, during which I find it difficult to get out of bed, am plagued with suicidal thoughts or am so panicked that I need to take medication to calm my heart rate. When these symptoms are occurring, the idea of being able to work is laughable.

headline.main: Must I Tell My Boss I’m Absent Because of Mental Illness?
headline.print_headline: Must I Tell My Boss I’m Absent Because of Mental Illness?

docs.abstract: Alan Hollinghurst, one of England’s most celebrated novelists, has changed with the times and found new ways to surprise.
docs.snippet: Alan Hollinghurst, one of England’s most celebrated novelists, has changed with the times and found new ways to surprise.
docs.lead_paragraph: When he was in his early 20s, Alan Hollinghurst, the English novelist, had a very English conversation with his father, a regional bank manager who served in the Royal Air Force during World War II. They were driving through rural Gloucestershire, where Hollinghurst grew up. An undergraduate at Oxford University, he’d recently come out to a fellow student. It was the mid-1970s, a time of liberation and experiment, but the sexual revolution, it seemed, had yet to reach the English countryside.

headline.main: The Evolution of One of Fiction’s Gay Liberators

docs.abstract: An attitude that feels thrilling in one era may well wind up feeling like everything wrong with the next.
docs.snippet: An attitude that feels thrilling in one era may well wind up feeling like everything wrong with the next.
docs.lead_paragraph: — From “A Futile and Stupid Gesture” (Netflix, 2018, directed by David Wain), adapted from the book of the same name by Josh Karp.

headline.main: New Sentences: From ‘A Futile and Stupid Gesture’

docs.abstract: Apply pressure. If the blood flow is heavy after 20 or 30 seconds, use a tourniquet.
docs.snippet: Apply pressure. If the blood flow is heavy after 20 or 30 seconds, use a tourniquet.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Apply pressure where the blood is coming out,” says Christopher B. Colwell, the chief of emergency medicine at Zuckerberg San Francisco General Hospital and Trauma Center. You may need to remove or rip open some of the victim’s clothing to access the injury. “Grab a shirt, a towel, a fabric bag — it doesn’t have to be clean,” Colwell says. Put the cloth over the wound, and push down continuously and forcefully on it with both hands until the bleeding stops.

docs.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on whether to pass on information about a deceptive ex-spouse, a possible insurance fraud and more.
docs.snippet: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on whether to pass on information about a deceptive ex-spouse, a possible insurance fraud and more.
docs.lead_paragraph: My sister-in-law was married to a man who looked good on paper and who was very charming. She found out after they were married that he lied to her about his employment history and history of drug and alcohol abuse, as well as about his finances. He had a breakdown soon after their child was born and received a diagnosis for a serious mental illness. When he was unmedicated, he was violent toward her. Even on medication, he has shown no remorse about the destruction he caused. He admitted that he spent the year before meeting her rehearsing his “story” so he could meet someone like her. He can still seem charming and, to an outsider, like a functioning adult.

headline.main: Should the New Girlfriend of an Awful Ex-Husband Be Warned?
headline.print_headline: Should the New Girlfriend Of an Awful Ex-Husband Be Warned?

docs.abstract: A dystopian show that will make you feel better about your own life.
docs.snippet: A dystopian show that will make you feel better about your own life.
docs.lead_paragraph: I cannot watch “Black Mirror” anymore. Its metaphors have grown stale, its winks are now klaxons and its messages — once distorted and eerie — now land with a thud. The same holds true for most so-called “prestige” television, from the violent, misogynist dystopia of “The Handmaid’s Tale” to the violent, misogynist dystopia of “Westworld.” They feel inevitable and manipulative, and watching them does nothing but intensify my already simmering anxieties — which I suspect is the point. So nowadays, when the kitchen is clean and the cats are fed and my brain is on its downward spiral toward sleep, all I want to do is sink into the couch and turn on “House Hunters,” a show about a specific kind of darkness I have complete control in avoiding. It provides all the thrill of a dystopian hellscape with none of the fear.

docs.abstract: In 2006, Jeremiah Foxwell became the Navy’s first known chemical-warfare casualty after the Iraq invasion, but the service refuses to award him a Purple Heart.
docs.snippet: In 2006, Jeremiah Foxwell became the Navy’s first known chemical-warfare casualty after the Iraq invasion, but the service refuses to award him a Purple Heart.
docs.lead_paragraph: The improvised explosive device that Petty Officer Third Class Jeremiah Foxwell approached in September 2006 resembled hundreds of others he had destroyed in and around Baghdad. On the ground was a damaged artillery shell that had been ejected by a roadside blast. Brown crystals around its nose looked like a homemade explosive that local insurgents often used.

headline.main: He Inhaled Mustard Agent in Iraq, but the Navy Denied Him a Purple Heart

docs.abstract: The actress and Democratic candidate for New York governor on marijuana, the black vote and fixing the subway.
docs.snippet: The actress and Democratic candidate for New York governor on marijuana, the black vote and fixing the subway.
docs.lead_paragraph: What would you say is harder: appearing in two concurrent Broadway shows when you were a full-time college student, or running for governor of New York State when most people know you only from “Sex and the City”? I think that running for office has pieces of stuff that I’ve done before, like interacting with and collaborating with people, trying to get the word out about the thing that you’re doing and trying to get people interested in it. But in politics, when people come after you, they really come after you.

headline.main: Cynthia Nixon Wants to Legalize It
headline.print_headline: Cynthia Nixon Wants to Legalize It
